name: Hyatt Regency Paris Charles de Gaulle

reviews.text: We stayed here just one night on the end of two week trip in France. Last time we stayed in the Paris city center and had to deal with the hectic trip to the airport, so we decided to stay near the airport and make it easy. Initially we planned on still heading to Paris, but we had just arrived from the 3 hour train ride from Bordeaux and to turn around and take another train to Paris for one last night of frolick just did not sound too appealing. I believe we figured that for the both of us (me and my husband) the cost to take the RER train into Paris and back to the hotel would have exceeded $100, and since we had both had been to Paris several times, we figured we would get just as much out of relaxing at the comf Hyatt hotel. So we stayed in and ordered room service -- it was great! After 2 weeks in France and staying in rented apartments, it was nice to stay at a place with English speaking channels as options on the TV. We also enjoyed the lounge in the main lobbym and while we only had wine, we enjoyed the endless un-requested refills of the wasabi cracker mix and the green olives. Breakfast was over the top -- most everything one would could want was there. Several meat, egg, and cheese options, in addition to pastries and breads and fruits and vegetables were available. I believe the breakfast option was included with our stay but this would have been something I would have been willing to pay extra for. The gym was fantastic. The gym was separated from the main building area which I like as this separaing added to its privacy (can't stand the hotels with the fishbowl gyms). The rooms were clean and bright and fresh and felt new. The way I recall it, the room furnishings felt more up to date the the actual hotel lobby, which while clean and attractive, felt a little circa 1993. Still it seemed in good shape, so not a complaint, just an observation. There were only 2 cons to this hotel in my opinion: the area around the hotel is pretty void of any place one could walk to for a quick bite -- one would need a cab or a shuttle to the train. And the next con is pretty common for most hotels I have seen in Europe -- the beds do not come with a top sheet, just a duvet. My American preference is for the top sheet!! The next day we took the hotel shuttle to CDG. I did not find the shuttle driver - a woman - to be overly nice or accomodating, so that was a little disappointing. But otherwise the hotel was great and I would definitely stay there again, as long as I did not have plans to go into Paris. If you want to go into Paris, just stay there in the city at one of the other Hyatt's or at a boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Easy breezy last night in Paris
moderate but comfort
reviews.text: I had stayed recently at Hyatt CDG airport and it’s an excellent hotel with amenities. The shuttle services are on time and you can plan your city visits.
The bell desk will not always attend you if you arrive with heavy luggage unless alerted after arrivals at lobby. There is no tea/coffee
reviews.title: Good layover at paris airport

reviews.text: making facilities in the room rather. The breakfast is excellent choice and bit limited seating area. There is an omelette station as well in the breakfast hall.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are neat and moderate amenities are provided to basic Hyatt standard.. Would be a good choice for quick business visits.
reviews.title: Great hotel near CDG

reviews.text: This place was great we arrived late from Beauvis don't ever fly in from there btw! Plush comfy rooms and beds clean fresh we were gutted we didn't stay longer next time il stay there a couple days to rest before a long haul flight! Breakfast was super good staff were great free shuttle to airport!! Well done Hyatt il return! Long way from central Paris around 45 mins but Grady from airport
reviews.title: Great way to end Europe tour

reviews.text: I recently stayed one night at the Hyatt Regency by CDG in Paris, and it was a great hotel. I was travelling on business and had an overnight before flying back to Canada. Didn't think much of the outside as I was driving up but inside is nice. Decent restaurant and lounge, the room was great. I stayed in a Club room so was a king bed with large bathroom and access to the club lounge which I didn't use. The room class came with free wifi and was very large and clean and comfortable. Complimentary shuttle to the airport every 20 mins. All around a great experience at the Hyatt; would definitely stay again and recommend to any travelers needing a place near the airport. Also a very nice breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Great stay for business trip

reviews.text: I have stayed here four or five times - the reception is typical Paris, typical Europe - you can feel yourself aging in the line to check in.
reviews.title: Expensive as hell but good facility

reviews.text: The staff isn't overly friendly on reception - again, welcome to Paris - but they are courteous enough and seem willing to explain your benefits if you have status with them. I am a Hyatt Passport member so usually at least score some free Wi-Fi.
reviews.title: Rip-Off Wifi charges

reviews.text: This last time I stayed my room was nice and cool - I ended up getting a double bed room (my company booked it) and the little bed was barely big enough for me alone. I will say this, though. My A/C was nice and cold - the shower was good and hot. The time before this stay, I couldn't get my room very cool, but it was almost 100 degrees out. I think the part of the hotel that is connected to the reception area is older or something, and the other hotel section across from reception may be better constructed.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel... but understand a few things.

reviews.text: It's a bit of trek from airport and shuttle bus doesn't run between around midnight and 6am. You can't walk it so for an early flight we were forced to take a taxi which cost 25 Euros. If you want a hotel to use between flights there are ones closer to the airport. From memory there is a hotel in the terminal. All this seems a bit frustrating when you are tired and jet-lagged and just need somewhere for a few hours kip before catching an onward flight. We landed at 11pm and had to call up the hotel at around midnight to enquire about the promised shuttle bus. Some other guests had been waiting over half an hour. Our outbound flight was 7.30am so staff told us we could only get to the airport by taxi (the driver ripped us off because he started running the meter when the first member of our party got downstairs rather than when we all got on board.... but there you go) Also, without moaning too much there was no bottled water in the rooms so the bar sold water for eight Euros! The staff seemed a bit embarrassed about this and very kindly only charged us for one bottle. The rooms and hotel interior are lovely.
reviews.title: Not really an airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice stay at the Hyatt Regency. it is a very nice hotel. We didn't spend much time (2 nights) but it was great!
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: all the staff is kind and careful to your needs. We arrived late at night even at that time, the staff was present to welcome us.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.text: It was a very good room for the price we payed and the food is very good there!!
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: By far one of the best airport hotels: It doesn't feel like an airport hotel.

reviews.text: We had arranged for a rental car at CDG, but thought we would save a day’s rental by using the shuttle of the Hyatt Regency at CDG. Wrong! To get to the shuttle, it is necessary to take a shuttle internal to the airport, carry one’s luggage across a large transportation center and take the escalator to the correct floor. Then, you must wait at least 20-minutes for the Hyatt shuttle. We decided to pick up our rental car and drive to the Hyatt. It is not easy to find, as the signage at CDG is very poor. We toured several villages near CDG and finally, through dead reckoning, found the hotel.
reviews.title: Is This Really a Hyatt Hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to go in search of a porter even though two were standing at the door. The check-in was very French, requiring the presentation of our passports (both of them!). Fortunately, my French is good so we were able to find the elevator. I had to return to the reception to obtain another key as my wife had gone to the room with the porter. The receptionist did not suggest another key! One needs a key to reach one’s floor; a good feature.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay if you have an early or late flight.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was informed by the reception that the daily price of parking was 29 € … for outdoor parking in a nearby lot!!!
reviews.title: Good but remote
29 euros for a call to Air France
reviews.text: The room was large enough for two with only one luggage rack. Another was not available when we called. The carpet was stained; the walls were marred and in need of paint; the bathroom was missing a light over the toilet. The closet was too narrow for our hanging bags. The entrance door looked as though a burglar had tried to enter.

We were hungry, so went to the Apollo Restaurant in the quite lovely lobby. The service was unbelievably bad. The waitress did not arrive for at least 10-minutes. She stopped on her way to the computer to place our order to chat with some of her friends. We waited! Finally, the manager arrived at our table to apologize for the delay, assuring us that our lunch would arrive in two-minutes. 15-minutes later, our lunch of a sandwich and salad arrived. From start to the arrival of our meal, 45-minutes transpired. I asked the manager about the nature of the delay; he replied, essentially, “…what problem?”
reviews.title: Good for layovers

aka: Hyatt Regency Paris Charles De Gaulle Hotel
description: Positioned near the main international airport in France, Hyatt Regency Paris – Charles de Gaulle is the ideal choice for Roissy Charles de Gaulle airport hotel guests. Our Roissy hotel is only 5 minutes by courtesy shuttle from the airport and a short drive from main exhibition centres, including Paris-Nord Villepinte and Le Bourget. The hotel is also convenient to Disneyland Paris (EuroDisney), Parc Astérix and Chantilly Castle, while guests of our Paris airport hotel enjoy privileged access to the Paris International Golf Club. Main attractions of central Paris, including the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame and the Louvre are only 30 minutes away. Hyatt Regency Paris – Charles de Gaulle hotel is a versatile business meeting and conference venue, offering 25 meeting rooms, advanced equipment and innovative catering.
